titleStmt.title: Whereas His Majesty hath been pleased to command me to take care that this present mourning may be performed with that decency that becomes so great an occasion by Henry Duke of Norfolk, Earl-Marshall of England.
titleStmt.author: Norfolk, Henry Howard, Duke of, 1655-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill decas'd, and by Henry Hills and Thomas Newcomb,

notesStmt.note: Title from opening line of statement.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
